sentences: Minulla on kolme viikkoa aikaa valmistautua kokeisiin.
context: The Finnish word 'viikko' means 'week'. It is a common noun used to refer to the seven-day period in time. In the examples, it's shown in different contexts - as a nominative form ('viikko'), partitive form ('viikkoa'), and in the possessive form ('viikon'). The word follows Finnish grammatical rules for noun inflection.
